comments:
When refactoring to rename a class, a JavaModelException occurs that is shown to the user and removes all breakpoints in the class.

The class must have a main method with a method breakpoint on main.  May apply to other static elements.

In Java 1.5 it appears to remove the breakpoints but does not display an error to the user.

Message shown to the user:

Java Model Exception: Java Model Status [main(java/lang/String[]) [in ABCD [in ABCD.java [in <default> [in src [in Test]]]]] does not exist]

Log:

!SESSION 2006-10-31 13:31:03.703 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20061031-0656
java.version=1.5.0_09
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.jdt.core 4 969 2006-10-31 13:34:17.718
!MESSAGE main(java/lang/String[]) [in ABCD [in [Working copy] ABCD.java [in <default> [in src [in Test]]]]] does not exist
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.jdt.core 4 969 2006-10-31 13:34:17.718
!MESSAGE main(java/lang/String[]) [in ABCD [in [Working copy] ABCD.java [in <default> [in src [in Test]]]]] does not exist

confirmed this happens in 1.5 and 1.6 vms, and only seems to happen if you have a method breakpoint set on a static method that has an array in the signature.

The removal of breakpoints occurs only after the refactoring has failed the first time, as the participant is no longer able to work with breakpoint changes.

Happens for static and non static methods that have any parameters. The parameters are unqualified in the source type, but we are providing a qualified signature, so the new method is thought not to exist.

Created an attachment (id=53144)
patch

Source methods always have unqualified signatures, so the patch searches the new destination type for a 'similar' method.

traces.message: main(java/lang/String[]) [in ABCD [in [Working copy] ABCD.java [in <default> [in src [in Test]]]]] does not exist
